org.knime.core.node.workflow

Class NodeContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.knime.core.node.workflow.NodeContext

  • public final class NodeContext
extends Object
    A NodeContext holds information about the context in which an operation on a node is executed. This is used for internal purposes, node implementors should not use this class.
    The node context is local to the current thread and is set by the workflow manager or the node container in which a node is contained. Each thread has a stack of NodeContext objects, only the last set context can be retrieved via getContext(). You must absolutely make sure that if you push a new context that you remove it afterwards. Therefore the common usage pattern is a follows: 
     NodeContext.pushContext(nodeContainer);
 try {
     doSomething();
 } finally {
     NodeContext.removeLastContext():
 }
    Since:
    2.8
    Author:
    Thorsten Meinl, KNIME.com, Zurich, Switzerland

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static NodeContext getContext()
      Returns the current node context or null if no context exists.
      (package private) static Deque<NodeContext> getContextStack()
      Returns the context stack for the current thread.
      NodeContainer getNodeContainer()
      Returns the node container which is currently executing something.
      WorkflowManager getWorkflowManager()
      Returns the workflow manager which currently does an operation on a node.
      static void pushContext(NodeContainer nodeContainer)
      Pushes a new context on the context stack for the current thread using the given node container.
      static void pushContext(NodeContext context)
      Pushes the given context on the context stack for the current thread.
      static void removeLastContext()
      Removes the top-most context from the context stack.
      String toString()

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getWorkflowManager

        public WorkflowManager getWorkflowManager()
        Returns the workflow manager which currently does an operation on a node. The result may be null if the workflow manager does not exist any more, i.e. its workflow has been closed. This is very likely an implementation error because nobody should hold a node context for a closed workflow.
        Returns:
        the workflow manager associated with the current node or null

      • getNodeContainer

        public NodeContainer getNodeContainer()
        Returns the node container which is currently executing something. The result may be null if the node container does not exist any more, i.e. its workflow has been closed. This is very likely an implementation error because nobody should hold a node context for a closed workflow.
        Returns:
        a node container or null

      • getContext

        public static NodeContext getContext()
        Returns the current node context or null if no context exists.
        Returns:
        a node context or null

      • pushContext

        public static void pushContext(NodeContainer nodeContainer)
        Pushes a new context on the context stack for the current thread using the given node container.
        Parameters:
        nodeContainer - the node container for the current thread, must not be null

      • removeLastContext

        public static void removeLastContext()
        Removes the top-most context from the context stack.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no context is available / if the context stack is empty

      • pushContext

        public static void pushContext(NodeContext context)
        Pushes the given context on the context stack for the current thread. The context may be null.
        Parameters:
        context - an existing context, may be null

      • getContextStack

        static Deque<NodeContext> getContextStack()
        Returns the context stack for the current thread. This methods has package scope on purpose so that the NodeExecutionJob has access to the stack and can save and restore it. See NodeExecutionJob.run().
        Returns:
        a stack with node contexts

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
